issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Hive.loadDynamicPartitions creates threads with new embedded rawstore, but never close them, thus we leak PersistenceManager one per such thread.

comments.body:

ATTACHMENT ID: 12870134 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Unit tests pass.

[~daijy]
Should it also call syncMetaStoreClient.close(); in Hive.close() ?
This seems to be unrelated. Do you mean to piggyback it in my patch?

This leak and also usage of syncMetaStoreClient seems to be from HIVE-14204 . Thats why I suggested it here.
We could track the syncMetaStoreClient.close() change in a separate jira as well, if you prefer that.
metaStoreClient is causing NPE in a test. We should use getMSC() instead.
This exposes HIVE-16825, should be fixed before commit.

Also; Hive client is used via a threadlocal. Is sharing metastore client between threads safe? That exception seems to imply someone closes metastore client while the pool threads are still running. I am guessing other code doesn't hit that because it calls getMSC, but the whole thing where some threads close and null it out and other threads reopen it, seems fragile.

Switch metaStoreClient to getMSC, also close syncMetaStoreClient as Thejas commented.

I think this Hive client is only shared with load-dynamic-partitions threads, and within the threads, write operations are synchronized via SynchronizedMetaStoreClient. cc [~rajesh.balamohan].

ATTACHMENT ID: 12871284 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

SynchronizedMetaStoreClient is used only in load-dynamic-partition threads. 

Should {{ObjectStore.shutdodown()}} set {{pm}} to null as this can be invoked lots of times?. Also getPartition() called via loadPartition() should be using "getSychronizedMSC()::getPartitionWithAuthInfo()" to be on safer side.
Good point to set pm to null. However, getPartition seems involve a big block and synchronize it needs nontrivial code refactory, I don't want to touch it for now.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12871649 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Test failures are not related. HIVE-14204.4.patch pushed to master. Thanks Prashant, Rajesh, Sergey, Thejas!
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
